channel.title: age-iat on Project Implicit's International Sites
channel.description: Recent content in age-iat on Project Implicit's International Sites

item.title: Test Figures Post
item.author: youremail@domain.com (Project Implicit)
item.description: Total N = 3203 Participation per year (N): Evaluation measures Note: Higher values indicate stronger bias in favor of the dominant category (young people). IAT: There is a strong bias in favor of Young people Self-reported preference between the categories: There is a strong bias in favor of Young people Self-reported feeling thermometer (difference score): There is a small bias in favor of Young people. The difference between the current and previous measure might result from the nature of each measure: while the Self-reported preference measure directly compares Young and Old people (as does the IAT), the thermometer does not compare the two categories directly.
